description: Introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty. This course is for BE majors ONLY, with preference given to BSE students.
name: PRECEPTORSHIP IN CLIN BE

values.comments:
This course is an introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty. This course is for BE majors ONLY, with preference given to BSE students.

Students overall found this course “very interesting” and “wonderful.” One student mentioned, “The clinical experience was absolutely fantastic.”

One student noted that “Dr. Buchsbaum didn\'t lecture throughout the course therefore I cannot make definite comments with regards to his teaching.”

One student wrote “The assignments are fairly easy,” while another believed that there is ”Too much … work required for this course.” In addition, one student noted, “There was not enough feedback from the instructors regarding the seminar reports or the papers.”

This course is an introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty. This course is for BE majors ONLY, with preference given to BSE students.

Students overall found this course “very interesting” and “wonderful.” One student mentioned, “The clinical experience was absolutely fantastic.”

The students had no comments regarding Professor Eckmann.

One student wrote, “The assignments are fairly easy,” while another believed that there is “Too much … work required for this course.” Also, one student noted, “There was not enough feedback from the instructors regarding the seminar reports or the papers.”
